a.style: font-family:"Playfair Display", Georgia, "Times New Roman", serif

text.tspan: Number of active State-based conflicts, World, 1946 to 2020
State-based conflicts are conflicts between two parties, where at least one is the government of a state. One-sided
violence – such as massacres or genocide – are not included.
Note: Ongoing conflicts are represented for every year in which they resulted in at least 25 direct deaths (civilian or military).
